turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Well hello there, young employee of the Sidewinder.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Look, I already told you I'm not going to give you a ride.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What can you tell me, young man, about the various flavors of "frozen yogurt"?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Look, I'll be done in a minute. Just wait outside.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'm afraid I don't understand. I simply wish to know --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: So Josh...

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Look, can we talk in a minute? I'm almost done.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That guy rules!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Who, Doug? He spends more time here than I do...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: So Josh, will you give us a ride? Please? Pretty please? It's going to be super fun!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Why do you even need a ride? You could walk there in two minutes.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It's just an excuse for us to spend time with you.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Aren't there a million places like this?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: This is the ultimate. It's like the Taj Mahal of bad, fake 50's diners.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: So, where's "Weird Al"?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: SHH! He's back there. I can see his hair bobbing up and down.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Yeah, right.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: No, I'm serious. Give us your whole basic philosophy in a nutshell.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That's not him... Jesus, stop freaking me out.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: In answer to your question, I suppose I endorse policies that are opposed to stupidity and violence and cruelty in any form...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I figured something like that...

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Jesus, look at this guy.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh my God, that's HIM!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Come on, Josh... don't you want to see where he lives?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: But this guy is like a one-of-kind, rare butterfly, and we have to follow him back to his natural habitat...

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: You need counseling.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Hi Josh.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I just stopped in to say hi.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Yeah, well... hi...

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Hi... what's up?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Can I come in?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Are you the one who left that note?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Do you want something to drink?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: What do you mean "why"?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Are you trying to get me wasted so you can take advantage of my womanly charms?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Yeah, right...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: "Yeah, right"... well why not?  What's so wrong with me?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Then why do you hate me so much?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: When did I say I hated you?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You've never once said anything even remotely nice to me.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: You make me nervous! I always feel like you're going out of your way to make me feel uncomfortable so you can laugh at me!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That's just the way I am!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Yeah, well --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It's just my stupid way of getting attention! God, I practically love you, Josh!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: You must have known all along how I -- you know -- how I felt about you -- it must be totally obvious...  God... I always used to dream about this...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Why do you have that stupid poster?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Oh, hi...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Why do all guys have to play stupid guitars? It's so typical... Either they're into cars or guns or sports or guitars... it's so obvious...

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: How long have you been up?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I couldn't sleep... I should get going; I feel really weird...

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Do you want to go get breakfast somewhere?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I don't think we should... Look, you have to totally promise me you won't tell Becky about this.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Because if you do, I'll kill you!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Okay... I promise.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Just take my word for it... if she ever finds out about this I'll never hear the end of it...

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Hi Enid.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Hey Josh.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Are you ready to go?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: God, what a bunch of retards...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I thought Chipmunk-face was never going to shut up.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I know, I liked her better when she was an alcoholic crack addict! She gets in one car wreck and all of a sudden she's Little Miss Perfect and everybody loves her.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: It's totally sickening.  Let's see if they gave me the right diploma...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What?... Oh suck my fucking dick!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: These assholes are saying that I have to go to Summer school and take some stupid art class!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Remember that stupid hippie art teacher who failed me sophomore year? I didn't think that just because you get an "F" that means you have to take the class over again.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You loser.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: This is so bad, it's almost good.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: This is so bad it's gone past good and back to bad again...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Just think, we'll never have to see any of these creepy faces ever again.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Unless they're in your Summer school class!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Shut up!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Uh oh... don't turn around...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What? Why?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Forget it...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Since when is she an "actress"?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I know, she needs to die immediately.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh my god, look! Is Stacy Himmler going out with Rod Harbaugh?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: How perfect.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: He better watch out or he'll get AIDS when he date-rapes her.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: God, just think, we'll never see Dennis again.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: God, think about that... that's actually totally depressing.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Look at these people behind you. I'm totally convinced they're Satanists.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Just look at them!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: So, when are we going to start looking for our apartment?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Soon... I have to wait and see how this Summer class goes.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Did you sign up yet?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, I just picked the one that sounded the easiest.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: God, it's so weird that we're finally out of high school... We've been waiting for this our whole life! Now we can get our own apartment and do anything we want.  It's such a weird feeling.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I know, it hasn't really hit me yet.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Hey, look, the satanists are leaving!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: We should follow them!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Much later.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: In fact, never.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What do you do if you're a satanist, anyway?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You know, sacrifice virgins and stuff...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: That lets us off the hook.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Maybe there's some weird secret satanic society that meets at the Quality Cafe and all of the other regular customers are in on it except for us.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Or maybe not.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Maybe they're slowly poisoning us or they're planning to brainwash us and --

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Okay, okay!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Hey, look at this...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: "Authentic 50's diner"? Since when were there mini-malls in the 1950's?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: God, it's so totally pathetic.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Who can forget this great hit from the 50's?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I feel as though I've stepped into a time warp!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Hi, Al!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Can we call you "Weird Al"?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I might actually get the pasta special.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You loser!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Did you notice all those weird things on the menu? Like "The Salad Explosion"?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I know... and instead of "dessert" it says "Mindbenders."

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What does that even mean?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Check out the Personals... maybe our future husbands are trying to contact us.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: God, this paper is so boring. Who reads all this shit?  Here we go...  "Windsurfing Doctor, Mensan IQ, maverick Sagittarius. Let's hit the clubs, make each other laugh!"

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You can have that one.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Okay, well here's yours...  "Who said all the most eligible bachelors are taken? Not this one! Stunning bod, very snugglelicious ocean sunset dreamer."

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Gross.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Jesus! Listen to this one: "Do you remember me? Airport shuttle, June 7th. You: striking redhead with yellow dress, pearl necklace, brown shoes. I was the bookish fellow in the green cardigan who helped you find your contact lens. Am I crazy, or did we have a moment?"

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: God, that's so pathetic. I bet she didn't even notice him.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I know. And he's like psychotically obsessing over every little detail.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: We should call him and pretend to be the redhead.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh, we totally have to.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Does Oomie really like this show?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Isn't it weird? It's her favorite.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: So what should we do?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Wait... I just want to see what's on this tape.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I dunno. John Ellis always puts on all this sick stuff that I have to fast-forward past to get to the good stuff.  There's supposed to be a Don Knotts movie on here someplace.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Hey - why do you have this?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You lent it to me in like tenth grade.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I've been looking all over for this.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Look at how cute I am!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What a little hosebag.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Look, that's back when I hated you.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I remember every minute of that party.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: There's my dad with Joanie.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I can never keep them all straight - was she the super-bitch?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: No, she was the second wife. The third one was the super-bitch - Maxine.  There! Look at her!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I want to do him!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I bet! Actually he reminds me of that one creep you went out with -- you always go for guys with some lame, fake shtick.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What are you talking about -- who?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That Larry guy -- what look was he going for? A gay tennis player from the forties?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Fuck you!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Hey! We forgot to call the loser!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Which loser?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You know, the green cardigan guy.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh yeah.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You call.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Why do I always have to do it?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You're better at it.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I remember when I first started reading these I thought DWF stood for "dwarf!"

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What does it stand for?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Shh, it's his answering machine...  We hear the indistinct traces of a musical message followed by a faint BEEP.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: God, I think Josh is too mature for us.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I know, look at the way he drives... he's like an old man.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, Josh, c'mon... MOVE IT!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Look, maybe that's him!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It's still twenty-five minutes early.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I want to "make love" to him.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'm going to tell him you said that.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: SHUT UP!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: She says she wants to MMPH!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Is he wearing a green cardigan?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What exactly is a cardigan anyway?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It's obviously him!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I can't believe it!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What's going on now? What's he doing?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh my god, he just ordered a giant glass of milk!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What's he doing now?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: He's still just sitting there. God, this is totally unbearable!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Do you think he knows?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I dunno...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Totally! Look!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: He's insane!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: We should follow him home.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: He doesn't even look that bummed out, really.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I know... wouldn't you be totally pissed off?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: This kind of thing must happen to him all the time.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: This is way too creepy.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: He won't see us... we'll just stalk him from a distance.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'm afraid if I see him, I'll start feeling really bad again.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: The W.C. Fields Fan Club Newsletter...  Oh my God, The National Psoriasis Foundation!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Bingo!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What should we do? What if he recognizes us?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Come on, it's too late now...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Ew, look at this...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Gross!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I think it's cute - look at his little weasel teeth.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Ew, it's like some gross rat...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: That was truly pathetic.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I know... I still can't get over that his name was "Seymour."

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: He was so excited when you bought that record -- you're a saint!... God, these apartments are super expensive...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It was so cute how he had his own little bags. I thought I was going to start crying!... Do you think they're gay?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What about the "striking redhead in the yellow dress"?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh yeah...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: He should totally just kill himself... Hey, here's one  ...Oh wait...  you have to share it with a non smoking feminist and her two cats...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I dunno... I kind of like him... He's the exact opposite of everything I really hate... In a way he's such a clueless dork that he's almost cool...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: That guy is many things but he definitely isn't "cool"... This one would be okay, but there's no kitchen...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, but... you know what I mean.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Not really...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Forget it, I can't explain it...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: We're not sure yet, that's why we're looking.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Somewhere downtown.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: "Funky"?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What, is she black now?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I've been thinking about when we look for our apartment how we have to try and convince people that we're like these totally rich yuppies...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: That's who people want to rent to. It's a known fact that it's way easier to get a job and everything if you're rich... All we have to do is buy a few semi-expensive outfits and act like it's no big deal... it'll be fun.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You just want an excuse to dress like some stupid fashion model without me making fun of you.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Just promise you'll do it.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Okay, okay, I promise... Jesus, you're out of your mind.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What? How long have you been standing there?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Did you have to buy new hair dye or did you still have some left over from eighth grade?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Fuck you, bitch!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: We still have to go in there sometime.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: It's always closed...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I bet they have tons of incredible shoes hidden in the back.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Let's go hassle Josh.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: "Hassle"?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: There he is...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: As always.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Waiting for the bus that never comes...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I wonder if he's just totally insane and he really thinks a bus is coming or --

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Why don't you ask him.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: JOSH!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: JOSH!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I'll bet he never jerks off...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, he's beyond human stuff like that.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Should we leave a note?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Why are we going here? I hate this place.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It'll only take a second.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What was that all about?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It's not like I'm some modern Punk dickhead... It's obviously supposed to be a 1977 Punk look, but I guess Johnny Fuckface is too stupid to get it!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I didn't get it either.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Everybody's too stupid!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: How about this one?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Hey, you have to see my new good luck charm.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Ew ... when did you get that?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: This morning at Seymour's garage sale.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: God, aren't you tired of Seymour yet?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: How about this?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Forget it. I'm sure it sucks. All these movies suck.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Let's get out of here, this place makes me sick.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: We have to do something fun tonight this is my last weekend of freedom before I start my stupid job.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I know a party we could go to...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What? Where?!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It's a surprise.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I don't believe you.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: If I promise you there's really a party with a lot of guys, do you promise you'll go?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I totally, totally hate you.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Aw c'mon, this is a fun party.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'll be right back, I'm gonna go get a beer.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Wait...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Give me all your money, bitch!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Where did you get that?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You won't believe it! Guess!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Anthony's II!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: No way... when?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Just now... I went with Seymour.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You cunt!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That guy is totally amazing.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: He does that every single day.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: God, how can you stand all these assholes?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I don't know... Some people are okay, but mostly I feel like poisoning everybody.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: At least the wheelchair guy is sort of entertaining...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: He's a total asshole... He doesn't even need that wheelchair, he's just totally lazy!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That rules!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: No, it doesn't. You'll see... you get totally sick of all the creeps and losers and weirdos.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: But those are our people...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Yeah, well...  So when are you going to get your job?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'm working on it... I've got a few leads... it's just that right now I have, all these projects that take up all my time.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Nothing. Don't worry... I promise I'll get a job next week.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: God, I can't believe you went to Anthony's without me.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: ...you don't have to make a million dollars -- just get any stupid job so we can at least start looking for an apartment.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I wonder if I hang around with you because you're like my surrogate mother figure or something. Like I have this subconscious biological need to be nagged and bitched at constantly.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You hang out with me because nobody else can stand to be around you.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Or maybe... did you ever think that deep down we really might be lesbos? Maybe that's why we spend so much time together.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You're gross.  See that guy?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Which one?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: He gives me a total boner!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: He's like the biggest idiot of all time!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You're just jealous.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, right... Believe me, at this point I'm over the fact that every single guy likes you better than me!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Face it, you hate every single boy on the face of the earth!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That's not true, I just hate all these obnoxious, extroverted, pseudo- bohemian losers!  Sometimes I think I act so weird because I'm crazy from sexual frustration.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Haven't you heard about the miracle of masturbation?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: ...maybe we should be lesbos...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Get away from me!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Are you kidding? It's a dream job! I can't believe you got a job like that without even trying... God, I wish that was my job...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, maybe it'll be okay. At least I'll get to see every movie for free, I guess... I had to lie and tell them I already graduated...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: When are you finally going to get your diploma?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I dunno, but next week is my last class...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Anyway, now we can start looking for the apartment...  Do you remember when we first came up with that whole idea of renting our own apartment?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Wasn't it like eighth grade?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Seventh... you wanted to move out right then!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That must have been when my dad was married to Maxine...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I remember our big plan was as soon as we got the apartment we were going to trick Daniel Dusentrieb into coming over and then fuck him.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: We were such desperate sluts back then.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What are you talking about? What kind of loser gets fired after one day?!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I told you - my manager was a total asshole! Don't worry, I'm going to get another job... and anyway, I have some ideas for how to make money in the meantime...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: This is it? I can't believe you're selling some of this stuff.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Fuck it. Everything must go!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Oh my god, I remember this hat... this was during your little old lady phase...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What was that all about? I thought everything must go!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh yeah right, like I'm gonna let some asshole with a goatee own Goofy Gus.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Now are you going to get a regular job?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Don't worry.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: If it makes you feel any better, I don't think you could've gotten more than ten bucks for all this stuff.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, thanks.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Do you want to do something tonight?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I can't, it's Seymour's birthday...  Shit! What time is it?  I have to go to the store! I was going to make him a cake...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Well, are we still going shopping tomorrow?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, I guess... call me...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I think one of us should fuck Josh...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Go ahead...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: No, really...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: God, you're really obsessed...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I am not -- I just think it'd be funny to see what he'd do...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I thought we decided that Josh was way too cool to be interested in sex, and that he's the only decent person left in the world and we would never want to bring him down to our level and all that...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, but maybe one of us should at least try...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: No matter what happened it would be a big disaster... Let's just try and keep everything the way it is.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Look, we have to get these...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I can't afford stuff like this right now.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I'm sick of waiting - we need to start getting stuff if we're ever going to move.  Aren't these the greatest towels?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Why do you care about this kind of stuff?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Don't you want nice stuff?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I can't imagine spending money on towels.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You don't have to. I'll pay for all the stuff right now and you can pay me back when you finally get a job.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You're insane.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Do you still want to go to that thing tonight?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What thing?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: That guy's band is playing tonight... Alien Autopsy.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh yeah... maybe... Seymour's going on his big date tonight and I kind of want to be around when he calls, so I can hear how bad it went.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: God, I'm so sick of Seymour.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Do you still want to do something tonight?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What happened to Seymour?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I can't believe it - he actually scored!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: How repulsive!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: So should I come over?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Actually, I'm just about to go out with some friends...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What are you talking about? Who?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Just some people from work...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I don't believe you.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Yeah well, you said you were busy... look, I'd better get going... I'll call you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Where are we? This is a weird neighborhood...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: It's a totally normal, average neighborhood!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I just mean it's weird to me... I've never been anywhere near here in my life.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Josh says this is a really good neighborhood...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What? When did you see Josh?!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: He came into work.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Why? What did he say?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: When was this?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I don't know! God, don't act so jealous I only talked to him for two minutes.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Twenty-seven fifty-three... do you see it?  That must be it...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Great...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What?! It looks totally normal... what's wrong with it?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I said "great"...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Oh yeah, I can tell you really love it!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Well, what am I supposed to say? "I can't wait to live in some depressing shit-hole in the middle of nowhere"?!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: There's something wrong with every single place we look at! Why don't you just come right out and tell me you don't want to move in with me?!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Because you'll freak out and act like a total psycho about it.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You're the psycho! You haven't been able to deal with anything since high school ended!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You're the one who's still living out some stupid seventh-grade fantasy!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: FUCK YOU! Have fun living with your dad for the rest of your life!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I need to talk to you.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'm sorry about the other day. I don't know what's wrong with me... I really do want to move in with you.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I don't know... I was thinking maybe I should live alone. I decided to rent that place we looked at. I'm moving in next week.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Please let me come with you. Please please please...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I don't know - I'm not sure it's a good idea.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Of course it's a good idea... it's our plan.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: But how are you gonna pay rent and everything? You don't even have a job.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'll get a job tomorrow, I promise. If I don't, you can totally tell me to fuck off.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: So, whaddya think?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It's fine.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: So where's all your stuff?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: There.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: That's all you're bringing?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'm gonna finish packing tonight... I'll bring it over tomorrow sometime.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What time?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I dunno...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Make sure you're here by noon - we have tons of stuff to do... Oh yeah! I have to show you something else!
